content: with fiberfill r 20 single_crochet 2 decrease x6 18 r 21 single_crochet 1 decrease x6 12 r 22 decrease x5 7 fasten_off and sew closed ❖ wings brown yarn 4 25mm hook chain 3 make a circle by slip stitching to the first chain r 1 chain 3 counts as treble_crochet treble_crochet 7 into the ch3 circle 8 turn r 2 chain 3 slip_stitch into the first st chain 3 slip_stitch into the next st x3 single_crochet 4 4 ch3+slip_stitch 4 single_crochet fasten_off leaving long yarn for sewing make 2 wings and sew onto opposite sides of the ducks body with the ch3 bumps towards the back of the duck i sewed them one row below the white of the neck and only along the top of the wing 4 copyright mysimplicitiesbymn 2025 all rights reserved all documents and pictures are property of megan nelson mysimplicitiesbymn no part of this publication may be reproduced and/or redistributed in any way part or whole it is prohibited to use my patterns for commercial purposes thank you for respecting copyright laws feet yellow yarn 2 75mm hook r 1 ml single_crochet 6 into the ml 6 r 2 single_crochet 1 increase x3 9 r 3 single_crochet 9 9 r 4 single_crochet 2 increase x3 12 hold the piece flat for the next row r 5 single_crochet 5 through the st of both sides of the piece chain 1 turn 5 r 6 3 half_double_crochet in the first st slip_stitch 1 st 3 half_double_crochet in the next st slip_stitch 1 st 3 half_double_crochet in the last st 9 half_double_crochet 2 slip_stitch fasten_off leaving long yarn for sewing make 2 feet before sewing move where the yarn comes out from by placing the needle inside the foot below the last st and out the bottom of the foot sew both feet underneath the ducks belly there s no specific placement for these just under the duck s belly sewn so they re matching 5 copyright mysimplicitiesbymn 2025 all rights reserved all documents and pictures are property of megan nelson mysimplicitiesbymn no part of this publication may be reproduced and/or redistributed in any way part or whole it is prohibited to use my patterns for commercial purposes thank you for respecting copyright laws duck bill yellow yarn 2 75mm hook chain 5 turn r 1 starting in 2nd chain from the hook and into the back bumps of the chain single_crochet 3 3 single_crochet in the next space turning the corner to work the opposite side of the chain working in the round single_crochet 2 2 single_crochet in the last st 10 r 2 single_crochet 10 in the round slip_stitch 1 st 10 fasten_off leaving long yarn for sewing sew the bill to the front of the duck s face 1 row below the eyes stuffing the bill is optional ❖ tuft of feathers on top optional take a strand of green yarn or whichever color used for the duck s head a few inches long
